tasks.task: Identifying Tasks and Subtasks from the Transcripts of a Farming and Policy Briefing
subtasks: Understanding on-farm practices like cover cropping, no-till or low-till, and diverse crop rotations
Implementing soil health management strategies (e.g., limited mechanical soil disturbance)
Reducing synthetic input dependence (herbicides, pesticides, fertilizers)
Monitoring and measuring soil health improvements and carbon sequestration
Educating and networking with fellow farmers, researchers, and communities
Addressing barriers such as inadequate funding and inconsistent technical resources
Promoting investment in decentralized food systems infrastructure and alternative funding mechanisms
Supporting regional processing centers and value-added products
Leveraging existing programs (like USDA crop insurance) to incentivize regenerative practices
Rotational grazing to mimic natural herd movements
Improving water management and soil health in grazing operations
Creating niche market products (e.g., bison meat snacks)
Establishing partnerships with local distributors and retailers
Engaging consumers through storytelling and brand development
Overcoming infrastructure challenges (e.g., limited processing capacity)
